pullRequest.title: Windows native support
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
Changes -   serve and model archive components have been migrated to windows with minor fixes.  Shell script based build, packaging, installation, and validation scripts have been migrated to python to support windows and existing platform support. This will help in reducing the overhead of maintaining multiple types of scripts.
This is implemented with an assumption that users will use Windows Powershell as an admin user.
At, present it has been tested on windows server 2019 [EC2 instance] however it should work fine windows 10 as well.
This is an umbrella PR to implement torchserve windows native support. All the PR which have been added for win native support will be merged to this branch i.e. issue_582.
Fixes #582
Here is the plan of action for implementing native support.

Type of change
Please delete options that are not relevant.

 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 This change requires a documentation update

Feature/Issue validation/testing
Please describe the tests [UT/IT] that you ran to verify your changes and relevent result summary. Provide instructions so it can be reproduced.
Please also list any relevant details for your test configuration.


 Test A


 Test B


UT/IT execution results


Logs


Checklist:

 Have you added tests that prove your fix is effective or that this feature works?
 New and existing unit tests pass locally with these changes?
 Has code been commented, particularly in hard-to-understand areas?
 Have you made corresponding changes to the documentation?

commit.message: Merge branch 'issue_582' of https://github.com/pytorch/serve into issue_582
move build and install to binaries dir
Doc fixes based on final code submission
Merge branch 'issue_582' of https://github.com/pytorch/serve into issue_582
[skip ci] updated build and install readmes
[skip ci] revert changes to circleci config

Merge pull request #707 from prashantsail/issue_582

Issue 582
Fixed test cases failure on high config machine
removed redundent wsl related shell scripts
Turn off artifact upload for testing

nodes.bodyText: This should be in reverse order
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@
+import os
+import sys
+import time
+import shutil
+
+# To help discover local modules
+REPO_ROOT = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)), "..")
+sys.path.append(REPO_ROOT)
+
+from scripts import tsutils as ts
+
+def clean_slate(): 
+    print("## Uninstall existing torchserve and model archiver")
+    if ts.is_conda_env():
+        cmd = "conda uninstall -y torchserve torch-model-archiver"
+    else:
+        cmd = "pip uninstall -y torchserve torch-model-archiver"
+    print(f"## In directory: {os.getcwd()} | Executing command: {cmd}")
+    os.system(cmd)
+    time.sleep(5)
+
+
+def install_torchserve():
+    print("## Install torchserve from source")
+    cmd = "pip install ."
+    print(f"## In directory: {os.getcwd()} | Executing command: {cmd}")
+    os.system(cmd)
+
+
+def install_torch_model_archiver():
+    print("## Install torch-model-archiver from source")
+    cmd = "pip install model-archiver/."
+    print(f"## In directory: {os.getcwd()} | Executing command: {cmd}")
+    os.system(cmd)
+
+
+def clean_up_build_residuals():
+    print("## Cleaning build residuals (__pycache__)")
+    try:
+        for (dirpath, dirnames, filenames) in os.walk(os.getcwd()):
+            if "__pycache__" in dirnames:
+                cache_dir = os.path.join(dirpath, "__pycache__")
+                print(f"## Removing - {cache_dir}")
+                shutil.rmtree(cache_dir)
+    except Exception as e:
+        print(f"#Error while cleaning cache file. Details - {str(e)}")
+
+
+def install_from_src():
+    clean_slate()
+    install_torchserve()
+    install_torch_model_archiver()

nodes.bodyText: I don't like the idea of having to specify each and every dependency in the cli like this. It is cumbersume. Why not just have --dev, --gpu etc. flags
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,109 @@
+import os
+import platform
+import argparse
+
+
+class Common():
+    def __init__(self):
+        # Assumption is nvidia-smi is installed on systems with gpu
+        self.is_gpu_instance = True if os.system("nvidia-smi") == 0 else False
+        self.torch_stable_url = "https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html"
+
+    def install_java(self):
+        pass
+
+    def install_nodejs(self):
+        pass
+
+    def install_torch_packages(self, cu101=False):
+        if self.is_gpu_instance:
+            if cu101:
+                os.system(f"pip install -U -r requirements/torch_cu101.txt -f {self.torch_stable_url}")
+            else:
+                os.system(f"pip install -U -r requirements/torch.txt -f {self.torch_stable_url}")
+        else:
+            os.system(f"pip install -U -r requirements/torch_cpu.txt -f {self.torch_stable_url}")
+
+    def install_python_packages(self, cu101=False):
+        self.install_torch_packages(cu101=cu101)
+        os.system("pip install -U -r requirements/developer.txt") # developer.txt also installs packages from common.txt
+        if os.system("conda") == 0: # If conda is available install conda-build package
+            os.system("conda install -y conda-build")
+
+    def install_node_packages(self):
+        os.system("npm install -g newman newman-reporter-html markdown-link-check")
+
+    def install_jmeter(self):
+        pass
+
+    def install_ab(self):
+        pass
+
+
+class Linux(Common):
+    def install_java(self):
+        os.system("apt-get install -y openjdk-11-jdk")
+
+    def install_nodejs(self):
+        os.system("curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_14.x | bash -")
+        os.system("apt-get update")
+        os.system("apt-get install -y nodejs")
+
+    def install_ab(self):
+        os.system("apt-get install -y apache2-utils")
+
+
+class Windows(Common):
+    def install_java(self):
+        pass
+
+    def install_nodejs(self):
+        pass
+
+    def install_ab(self):
+        pass
+
+
+class Darwin(Common):
+    def install_java(self):
+        os.system("brew tap AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk")
+        os.system("brew cask install adoptopenjdk11")
+
+    def install_nodejs(self):
+        os.system("brew install node")
+
+    def install_torch_packages(self, cu101=False):
+        os.system(f"pip install -U -r requirements/torch.txt -f {self.torch_stable_url}")
+
+
+if __name__ == "__main__":
+    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Install various build and test dependencies of TorchServe")

nodes.bodyText: Please rename this to something generic and convert to a positional arg. We will have other versions of cuda in the future and it doesn't make sense to have an arg for each version.
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText: NIT: I see this being used in 1 place. Was there any reason to making this a separate class?
NIT: Do we really need this as a configurable param?
NIT: I am not sure what "being certified" means in this context

nodes.bodyText: Please remove this. This should only be for local testing

@dhaniram-kshirsagar What I meant was that instead of having --java --nodejs --cu101 etc. we should have something like a --dev flag which install all these dependencies at once. Not a big deal though.

nodes.bodyText:
@dhaniram-kshirsagar What I meant was to have an arg like cuda=cu101 so that in the future we can accomodate other versions of cuda e.g. cuda=cu110 without the need for adding new cli arguments.
parser.add_argument('cuda', choices=['cu101'])

commit.message: Merge branch 'issue_582' of https://github.com/pytorch/serve into issue_582

Fixed linux specific issue# Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting# with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit.## Committer: dhaniram-kshirsagar <dhaniram-kshirsagar>## On branch issue_582# Your branch is ahead of 'origin/issue_582' by 1 commit.#   (use "git push" to publish your local commits)## Changes to be committed:#	modified:   frontend/server/src/main/java/org/pytorch/serve/wlm/ModelManager.java#	modified:   ts/torch_handler/unit_tests/test_image_classifier.py#	modified:   ts/torch_handler/unit_tests/test_image_segmenter.py#	modified:   ts/torch_handler/unit_tests/test_object_detector.py#	modified:   ts/torch_handler/unit_tests/test_utils/mock_context.py## Untracked files:#	.coverage#	logs/#	model-archiver/.coverage#	model-archiver/result_units/#	model_store/#	result_units/#
Turning off link checker against issue #787
Install conda-build if conda is available
Updated README.md files for Win support
Small corrections in ts utility methods
indentation and correction to unregister utility
conda build requires install dependencies in build job
return from link_check func instead of exit
install utils is ts utils stage 1
sys path in install as well
comments, prints, modules, case changes, var name changes
Rename python tests to torchserve tests and refactor
Error messages specific as per failure
print msgs in install from source
Removed sys.path hack after movement of scripts
[skip ci] corrected command as per condition

Merge pull request #700 from prashantsail/issue_582

support for win native
install from source does not handle dependency installation
install java dependencies for linux and macos
Simplified python and torch package installation

Merge pull request #702 from prashantsail/issue_582

Issue 582

added python based torchsanity.
- update buildspec wrt python code

Merge pull request #698 from AshwinChafale/issue_582

Minor updates in example scripts for Win native support
commented buildspec.yml to test window env
Added frontend gradle tests in Torchsanity.py
Merge branch 'codebuild_issue_582' of https://github.com/shivamshriwas/serve into codebuild_issue_582
sys path hack to import relative to file
repo root relative current file,  exit only on failure
